lines.text: You would haue them alwaies play but one thing.

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: I would alwaies haue one play but one thing.

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: But Host, doth this Sir {% italic: Protheus %}, that we talk on,

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: Often resort vnto this Gentlewoman?

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: I tell you what {% italic: Launce %} his man told me,

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: He lou'd her out of all nicke.

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: Where is {% italic: Launce %}?

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: Gone to seeke his dog, which to morrow, by his

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: Peace, stand aside, the company parts.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Thurio %}, feare not you, I will so pleade,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That you shall say, my cunning drift excels.

lines.speaker: Th.
lines.text: Where meete we?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: At Saint {% italic: Gregories %} well.

lines.speaker: Th.
lines.text: Farewell.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Madam: good eu'n to your Ladyship.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I thanke you for your Musique (Gentlemen)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Who is that that spake?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: One (Lady) if you knew his pure hearts truth,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: You would quickly learne to know him by his voice.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Protheus %}, as I take it.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Protheus %} (gentle Lady) and your Seruant.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: What's your will?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That I may compasse yours.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: You haue your wish: my will is euen this,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: That presently you hie you home to bed:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thou subtile, periur'd, false, disloyall man:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Think'st thou I am so shallow, so conceitlesse,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To be seduced by thy flattery,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: That has't deceiu'd so many with thy vowes?

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Returne, returne, and make thy loue amends:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: For me (by this pale queene of night I sweare)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I am so farre from granting thy request,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: That I despise thee, for thy wrongfull suite;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And by and by intend to chide my selfe,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Euen for this time I spend in talking to thee.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I grant (sweet loue), that I did loue a Lady,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But she is dead.

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: 'Twere false, if I should speake it;

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: For I am sure she is not buried.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Say that she be: yet {% italic: Valentine %} thy friend

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Suruiues; to whom (thy selfe art witnesse)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I am betroth'd; and art thou not asham'd

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To wrong him, with thy importunacy?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I likewise heare that {% italic: Valentine %} is dead.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And so suppose am I; for in his graue

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Assure thy selfe, my loue is buried.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Sweet Lady, let me rake it from the earth.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Goe to thy Ladies graue, and call hers thence,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Or at the least, in hers sepulcher thine.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: He heard not that.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Madam: if your heart be so obdurate:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Vouchsafe me yet your Picture for my loue,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: The Picture that is hanging in your chamber:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: To that ile speake, to that ile sigh and weepe:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: For since the substance of your perfect selfe

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Is else devoted, I am but a shadow;

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And to your shadow will I make true love.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If 'twere a substance, you would sure deceive it,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And make it but a shadow, as I am.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I am very loath to be your Idoll, sir;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: But since your falsehood shall become you well

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To worship shadows and adore false shapes,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Send to me in the morning, and ile send it;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And so, good rest.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: As wretches have ore‑night

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That wait for execution in the morne.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: {% italic: Host %}, will you goe?

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: By my hallidome, I was fast asleepe.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Pray you, where lies {% italic: Sir Protheus %}?

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: Marry, at my house:

lines.speaker: Ho.
lines.text: Trust me, I think 'tis almost day.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Not so; but it hath been the longest night

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That ere I watch'd, and the most heauiest.

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: This is the hour that Madam {% italic: Siluia %}

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Entreated me to call and know her minde:

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Ther's some great matter she'ld employ me in.

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Madam, madam.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Who cals?

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Your seruant and your friend;

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: One that attends your Ladiships command.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: {% italic: Sir Eglamore %}, a thousand times good morrow.

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: As many (worthy lady) to your selfe:

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: According to your Ladiships impose,

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: I am thus early come, to know what seruice

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: It is your pleasure to command me in.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Oh {% italic: Eglamoure %}, thou art a Gentleman:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thinke not I flatter, (for I sweare I doe not)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Valiant, wise, remorse‑ful, well accomplish'd.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thou art not ignorant what deere good will

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I beare vnto the banish'd {% italic: Ualentine %}:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Nor how my father would enforce me marry

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Vaine {% italic: Thurio %}, (whom my very soule abhor'd.)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thy selfe hast lou'd; and I haue heard thee say

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: No griefe did euer come so neere thy heart

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: As when thy Lady and thy true‑loue dide,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Vpon whose Graue thou vow'dst pure chastitie:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Eglamoure: %} I would to {% italic: Valentine %},

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To {% italic: Mantua %}, where I heare, he makes abord;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And, for the waies are dangerous to passe,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I doe desire thy worthy company,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Vpon whose faith and honor, I repose.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Vrge not my fathers anger, ( {% italic: Eglamoure %}),

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: But thinke vpon my griefe (a Ladies griefe)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And on the justice of my flying hence

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To keep me from a most unholy match,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Which heauen and fortune still rewards with plagues.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I doe desire thee, euen from a heart

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: As full of sorrowes, as the Sea of sands,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: To beare me company, and goe with me:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: If not, to hide what I have said to thee,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: That I may venture to depart alone.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: Madam, I pity much your grieuances;

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: Which, since I know they vertuously are plac'd,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: I giue consent to goe along with you,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: Wreaking as little what betideth me,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: As much, I wish all good befortune you.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: When will you goe?

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: This euening comming.

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Where shall I meete you?

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: At {% italic: Frier Patrickes %} Cell,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Where I intend holy Confession.

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: I will not faile your Ladiship:

lines.speaker: Eg.
lines.text: Good morrow (gentle Lady.)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Good morrow, kinde Sir {% italic: Eglamoure %}.

lines.speaker: Lau.
lines.text: When a mans seruant shall play the Curre with {% italic: Siluia %} from my Master; and I came no {% italic: Siluia %}: did

lines.speaker: Lau.
lines.text: not I bid thee still marke me, and doe as I do; when did'st

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: {% italic: Sebastian %} is thy name: I like thee well,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And will imploy thee in some seruice presently.

lines.speaker: Iu.
lines.text: In what you please; ile doe what I can.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I hope thou wilt.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: How now you whor‑son pezant.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Where haue you bin these two dayes loytering?

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: Marry Sir, I carried Mistris {% italic: Siluia %} the dogge you

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And what saies she to my little Iewell?

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: Marry she saies your dog was a cur, and tels you

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But she receiu'd my dog?

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: No indeede did she not:

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: Here haue I brought him backe againe.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: What, didst thou offer her this from me?

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: I Sir, the other Squirrill was stolne from me

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: By the Hangmans boys in the market place,

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: And then I offer'd her mine owne, who is a dog

lines.speaker: La.
lines.text: As big as ten of yours, and therefore the guift the greater.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Goe, get thee hence, and finde my dog againe,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Or nere returne againe into my sight.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Away, I say: stayest thou to vexe me here;

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: A Slaue, that still an end, turnes me to shame:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: {% italic: Sebastian %}, I have entertained thee,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Partly that I haue neede of such a youth

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That can with some discretion doe my businesse:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: For 'tis no trusting to yond foolish Lowt,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But chiefely, for thy face, and thy behauiour,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Which (if my Augury deceiue me not)

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Witness good bringing vp, fortune, and truth:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Therefore know thee, for this I entertaine thee.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Go presently, and take this Ring with thee,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Deliuer it to Madam {% italic: Siluia %};

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: She lou'd me well, deliuer'd it to me.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: It seemes you lou'd not her, to leaue her token:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She is dead belike?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Not so: I thinke she liues.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Alas.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Why do'st thou cry alas?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I cannot choose but pitty her.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Wherefore should'st thou pitty her?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Because, me thinkes that she lou'd you as well

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: As you doe loue your Lady {% italic: Siluia %}:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She dreames on him, that has forgot her loue,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: You doate on her, that cares not for your loue.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: 'Tis pitty Loue, should be so contrary;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And thinking on it makes me cry alas.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Well: giue her that Ring, and therewithall

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: This Letter: that's her chamber: Tell my Lady

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I claime the promise for her heauenly Picture:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Your message done, hye home vnto my chamber,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Where thou shalt finde me sad, and solitarie.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: How many women would doe such a message?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Alas poore {% italic: Protheus %}, thou hast entertain'd

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: A Foxe to be the Shepheard of thy Lambs;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Alas, poore foole, why doe I pitty him

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That with his very heart despiseth me?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Because he loues her, he despiseth me;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Because I loue him, I must pitty him.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: This Ring I gaue him, when he parted from me,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To binde him to remember my good will:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And now am I (vnhappy Messenger)

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To plead for that, which I would not obtaine;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To carry that, which I would have refus'd;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To praise his faith, which I would have disprais'd.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I am my Masters true confirmed Loue,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: But cannot be true seruant to my Master,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Vnless I proue false traitor to my selfe.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Yet will I woe for him, but yet so coldly

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: As (heauen it knowes) I would not have him speed.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Gentlewoman, good day: I pray you be my meane

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To bring me where to speake with Madam {% italic: Siluia %}.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: What would you with her, if that I be she?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If you be she, I do entreat your patience

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To heare me speake the message I am sent on.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: From whom?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: From my Master, Sir {% italic: Protheus %}, Madam.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Oh: he sends you for a Picture?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I, Madam.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Vrsula, bring my Picture there,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Goe, giue your Master this: tell him from me,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: One {% italic: Iulia %}, that his changing thoughts forget

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Would better fit his Chamber, then this Shadow.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Madam, please you peruse this Letter;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Pardon me (Madam) I have vnaduis'd

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Deliuer'd you a paper that I should not;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: This is the Letter to your Ladiship.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I pray thee let me looke on that againe.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: It may not be: good Madam pardon me.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: There, hold:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I will not looke vpon your Masters lines:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I know they are stuft with protestations,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And full of new‑found oaths, which he will breake

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: As easily as I doe teare his paper.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Madam, he sends your Ladiship this Ring.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: The more shame for him, that he sends it me;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: For I haue heard him say a thousand times

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: His {% italic: Iulia %} gave it him, at his departure:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Though his false finger have prophan'd the Ring,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Mine shall not doe his {% italic: Iulia %} so much wrong.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She thankes you.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: What sai'st thou?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I thank you Madam, that you tender her:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Poor Gentlewoman, my Master wrongs her much.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Do'st thou know her?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Almost as well as I doe know my selfe.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To thinke vpon her woes, I doe protest

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That I haue wept a hundred severall times.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Belike she thinks that {% italic: Protheus %} hath forsook her?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I thinke she doth: and that's her cause of sorrow.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Is she not passing faire?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She hath been fairer (Madam) than she is,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: When she did thinke my Master lou'd her well;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She, in my iudgement, was as faire as you.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: But since she did neglect her looking‑glasse

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And threw her Sun‑expelling Masque away,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: The ayre hath staru'd the roses in her cheekes,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And pinch'd the lilly‑tincture of her face,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That now she is become as blacke as I.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: How tall was she?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: About my stature: for at {% italic: Pentecost %},

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: When all our Pageants of delight were plaid,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Our youth got me to play the womans part,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And I was trim'd in Madam {% italic: Iulias %} gowne,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Which serued me as fit, by all mens iudgements,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: As if the garment had bin made for me:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Therefore I know she is about my height,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And at that time I made her weepe a good,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: For I did play a lamentable part.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: (Madam) 'twas {% italic: Ariadne %}, passioning

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: For {% italic: Thesus %} periury, and vniust flight;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Which I so liuely acted with my teares:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That my poor Mistris moued therewithall,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Wept bitterly: and would I might be dead

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If I in thought felt not her very sorrow.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: She is beholding to thee (gentle youth)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Alas (poore Lady) desolate, and left;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I weepe my selfe to thinke vpon thy words:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Here youth: there is my purse; I giue thee this

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: For thy sweet Mistris sake, because thou lou'st her. Fare­ ( well.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And she shall thanke you for't, if ere you know ( her.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: A vertuous gentlewoman, milde, and beautifull.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I hope my Masters suit will be but cold,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Since she respects my Mistris loue so much.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Alas, how loue can trifle with it selfe:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Here is her Picture: let me see. I thinke

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If I had such a Tyre, this face of mine

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Were full as louely, as is this of hers;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And yet the Painter flatter'd her a little,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Vnlesse I flatter with my selfe too much.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Her haire is {% italic: Aburne %}, mine is perfect {% italic: Yellow %};

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If that be all the difference in his loue,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Ile get me such a coulour'd Perrywig:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Her eyes are grey as glasse, and so are mine:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I, but her fore‑head's low, and mine's as high:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: What should it be that he respects in her

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: But I can make respectiue in my selfe?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: If this fond Loue, were not a blinded god.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Come shadow, come, and take this shadow vp,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: For 'tis thy riuall: O thou sencelesse forme,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Thou shalt be worship'd, kiss'd, lou'd, and ador'd;

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And were there sence in his Idolatry,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: My substance should be statue in thy stead.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Ile vse thee kindly, for thy Mistris sake

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That vs'd me so: or else, by {% italic: Ioue %}, I vow,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: I should haue scratch'd out your vnseeing eyes,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: To make my Master out of loue with thee.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: The Sun begins to guild the westerne skie,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: And now it is about the very houre

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: That {% italic: Siluia %} at Fryer {% italic: Patricks %} Cell should meet me.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: She will not faile; for Louers breake not houres,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: Vnlesse it be to come before their time,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: So much they spur their expedition.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: See where she comes: Lady a happy euening.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Amen, Amen: goe on, (good {% italic: Eglamoure %})

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Out at the postern by the Abbey wall;

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I fear I am attended by some Spies.

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: Feare not: The Forrest is not three leagues off,

lines.speaker: Egl.
lines.text: If we recouer that, we are sure enough.

lines.speaker: Th.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Protheus %}, what saies {% italic: Siluia %} to my suit?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Oh Sir, I finde her milder than she was'

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And yet she takes exceptions at your person.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: What? that my leg is too long?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: No, that it is too little.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Ile weare a Booet to make it somewhat roun­ ( der.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But loue will not be spurd to what it loathes.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: What saies she to my face?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: She saies it is a faire one.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Nay then the wanton lies; my face is blacke.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But Pearles are faire; and the old saying is,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Blacke men are Pearles in beauteous Ladies eyes.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: 'Tis true, such Pearles as put out Ladies eyes,

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: For I had rather winke, then looke on them.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: How likes she my discourse?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Ill, when you talke of war.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: But well when I discourse of loue and peace?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: But better indeede, when you hold you peace.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: What sayes she to my valour?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Oh Sir, she makes no doubt of that.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: She needes not, when she knowes it cowardize.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: What saies she to my birth?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That you are well deriu'd.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: True: from a Gentleman, to a foole.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Considers she my Possessions?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Oh, I: and pitties them.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Wherefore?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: That such an Asse should owe them.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That they are out by Lease.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Here comes the Duke.

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: How now Sir {% italic: Protheus %}; how now, {% italic: Thurio %}?

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Which of you saw {% italic: Eglamoure %} of late?

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Not I.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Nor I.

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Saw you my daughter?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Neither.

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Why then

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: She's fled vnto that peasant, {% italic: Valentine %};

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: And {% italic: Eglamoure %} is in her Company:

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: 'Tis true; for Frier {% italic: Laurence %} met them both

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: As he, in pennance wander'd through the Forrest:

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Him he knew well, and guess'd that it was she,

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: But being mask'd, he was not sure of it.

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Besides, she did intend Confession

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: At {% italic: Patricks %} Cell this euen, and there she was not.

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: These likelihoods confirme her flight from hence;

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Therefore I pray you stand, not to discourse,

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: But mount you presently, and meete with me

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Vpon the rising of the Mountaine foote

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: That leads toward {% italic: Mantua %}, wether they are fled:

lines.speaker: Du.
lines.text: Dispatch (sweet Gentlemen) and follow me.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Why this it is, to be a peeuish Girle,

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: That flies her fortune when it followes her:

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Ile after; more to be reueng'd on {% italic: Eglamoure, %}

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Then for the loue of reck‑lesse {% italic: Siluia %}.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And I will follow, more for {% italic: Siluias %} loue

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Then hate of {% italic: Eglamoure %} that goes with her.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And I will follow, more to crosse that loue

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Than hate for {% italic: Siluia %}, that is gone for loue.

lines.speaker: 1. Out.
lines.text: Come, come be patient:

lines.speaker: 1. Out.
lines.text: We must bring you to our Captaine.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: A thousand more mischances than this one

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Haue learn'd me how to brooke this patiently.

lines.speaker: 2 Out.
lines.text: Come, bring her away.

lines.speaker: 1 Out.
lines.text: Where is the Gentleman that was with her?

lines.speaker: 3 Out.
lines.text: Being nimble footed, he hath out‑run vs.

lines.speaker: 3 Out.
lines.text: But {% italic: Moyses %} and {% italic: Valerius %} follow him:

lines.speaker: 3 Out.
lines.text: Goe thou with her to the West end of the wood,

lines.speaker: 3 Out.
lines.text: There is our Captaine: Wee'll follow him that's fled,

lines.speaker: 3 Out.
lines.text: The Thicket is beset; he cannot scape.

lines.speaker: 1 Out.
lines.text: Come, I must bring you to our Captains caue.

lines.speaker: 1 Out.
lines.text: Feare not: he beares an honourable minde,

lines.speaker: 1 Out.
lines.text: And will not vse a woman lawlesly.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: O {% italic: Valentine %}: this I endure for thee.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: How vse doth breed a habit in a man?

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: This shadowy desart, vnfrequented woods

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: I better brooke then flourishing peopled Townes:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Here can I sit alone, vn‑seene of any,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And to the Nightingales complaining Notes

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Tune my distrestes, and record my woes.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: O thou that dost inhabit in my brest,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Leaue not the Mansion so long Tenant‑lesse,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Lest growing ruinous, the building fall

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And leaue no memory of what it was,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Repair me with thy presence, {% italic: Siluia %}:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Thou gentle Nimph, cherish thy for‑lorne swaine.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: What hallowing, and what stir is this to day?

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: These are my mates, that make their wills their Law,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Haue some vnhappy passenger in chace;

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: They loue me well: yet I haue much to doe

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: To keepe them from vnciuill outrages.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Withdraw thee {% italic: Valentine %}: who's this comes heere?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Madam, this seruice I haue done for you

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: (Though you respect not aught your seruant doth)

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: To hazard life, and reskew you from him,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: That would haue forc'd your honour, and your loue,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair looke:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: (A smaller boone than this I cannot beg,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And lesse than this, I am sure you cannot giue.)

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: How like a dreame is this? I see, and heare:

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: Loue, lend me patience to forbear a while.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: O miserable, vnhappy that I am.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Vnhappy were you (Madam) ere I came:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But by my comming I haue made you happy.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: By thy approach thou mak'st me most vnhappy.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And me, when he approacheth to your presence.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Had I been ceazed by a hungry Lion,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I would haue been a break‑fast to the Beast,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Rather than haue false {% italic: Protheus %} reskue me:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Oh heauen be iudge how I loue {% italic: Valentine %},

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Whose life's as tender to me as my soule,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And full as much (for more there cannot be)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: I doe detest false periur'd {% italic: Protheus %}:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Therefore be gone, sollicit me no more.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: What dangerous action, stood it next to death

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Would I not vndergoe, for one calme looke:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Oh 'tis the curse in Loue, and still approu'd,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: When women cannot loue, where they're belou'd.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: When {% italic: Protheus %} cannot loue, where he's belou'd:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Read over {% italic: Iulia's %} heart, (thy first best Loue)

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: For whose deare sake, thou didst then rend thy faith

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Into a thousand oathes; and all those oathes,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Descended into periury, to loue me,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thou hast no faith left now, vnlesse thou'dst two,

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: And that's farre worse than none: better haue none

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Then plurall faith, which is too much by one:

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Thou Counterfeyt, to thy true friend.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: In Loue,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Who respects friend?

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: All men but {% italic: Protheus %}.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Nay, if the gentle spirit of mouing words

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Can no way change you to a milder forme;

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Ile wooe you like a Souldier, at armes end,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: And loue you 'gainst the nature of Loue: force ye.

lines.speaker: Sil.
lines.text: Oh heauen.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Ile force thee yeeld to my desire.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Ruffian: let go that rude vnciuill touch,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Thou friend of an ill fashion.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: {% italic: Ualentine. %}

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Thou friend, that's without faith or loue,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: For such is a friend now: treacherous man,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Thou hast beguil'd my hopes; nought but mine eye

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Could have perswaded me: now I dare not say

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: I haue one friend aliue: thou wouldst disproue me:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Who should be trusted, when ones right hand

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Is periured to the bosome? {% italic: Protheus %}

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: I am sorry I must neuer trust thee more,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: But count the world a stranger for thy sake:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: The priuate wound is deepest: oh time, most accurst:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: 'Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst?

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: My shame and guilt confounds me;

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Forgiue me, {% italic: Valentine %}: if hearty sorrow

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Be a sufficient Ransome for offence,

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I tender't heere: I do as truely suffer

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: As ere I did commit.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Then I am paid:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And once againe, I doe receiue thee honest;

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Who by Repentance is not satisfied

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Is nor of heauen, nor earth: for these are pleas'd:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: By Penitence th'Eternalls wrath's appeas'd;

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And that my loue may appeare plaine and free,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: All that was mine, in Siluia, I giue thee.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Oh me vnhappy.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Looke to the Boy.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Why, Boy?

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Why wag: how now? what's the matter? look vp: speak.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: O good sir, my master charg'd me to deliuer a ring {% italic: Siluia %}: w c (out of my neglect) was neuer done.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Where is that ring? boy?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Heere 'tis: this is it.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: How? let me see.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Why this is the ring I gaue to {% italic: Iulia %}.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Oh, cry you mercy, sir, I haue mistooke:

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: This is the ring you sent to {% italic: Siluia %}.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But how cam'st thou by this ring? at my depart

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: I gaue this vnto {% italic: Iulia %}.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And {% italic: Iulia %} herself did giue it me,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And {% italic: Iulia %} herself hath brought it hither.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: How? {% italic: Iulia %}?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Behold her, that gaue ayme to all thy oathes,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And entertain'd 'em deepely in her heart.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: How oft hast thou with periury cleft the roote?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Oh {% italic: Protheus %}, let this habit make thee blush.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Be thou asham'd that I have tooke vpon me

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Such an immodest rayment; if shame liue

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: In a disguise of loue?

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: It is the lesser blot modesty findes,

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: Women to change their shapes, then men their minds.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Then men their minds? tis true: o heuen, were man

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: But Constant, he were perfect; that one error

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Fils him with faults: makes him run through all th'sins:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Inconstancy falls‑off, ere it begins:

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: What is in {% italic: Siluia's %} face, but I may spie

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: More fresh in {% italic: Iulia's %}, with a constant eye?

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: Come, come: a hand from either:

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: Let me be blest to make this happy close:

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: 'Twere pitty two such friends should be long foes.

lines.speaker: Pro.
lines.text: Beare witnes (heauen) I haue my wish for euer.

lines.speaker: Iul.
lines.text: And I mine.

lines.speaker: Out‑l.
lines.text: A prize: a prize: a prize.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Forbeare, forbeare I say: It is my Lord the {% italic: Duke %}.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Your Grace is welcome to a man disgrac'd,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Banished {% italic: Valentine %}.

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Valentine %}?

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Yonder is {% italic: Siluia %}: and {% italic: Siluia's %} mine.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: {% italic: Thurio %} giue backe; or else embrace thy death:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Come not within the measure of my wrath:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Doe not name {% italic: Siluia %} thine: if once againe,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: {% italic: Uerona %} shall not hold thee: heere she stands

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Take but possession of her, with a Touch:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: I dare thee, but to breath vpon my Loue.

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: Sir {% italic: Valentine %}, I care not for her, I:

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: I hold him but a foole that will endanger

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: His Body, for a Girle that loues him not:

lines.speaker: Thu.
lines.text: I claime her not, and therefore she is thine.

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: The more degenerate and base art thou

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: To make such meanes for her, as thou hast done,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: And leaue her on such slight conditions:

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Now, by the honor of my Ancestry,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: I doe applaud thy spirit, {% italic: Valentine %},

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: And think thee worthy of an Empresse loue:

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Know then, I here forget all former greefes,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Cancell all grudge, repeale thee home againe,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Plead a new state in thy vn‑riual'd merit,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: To which I thus subscribe: Sir {% italic: Ualentine %},

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Thou art a Gentleman, and well deriu'd,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Take thou thy {% italic: Siluia %}, for thou hast deseru'd her.

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: I thank your Grace; yͤ gift hath made me happy:

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: I now beseech you (for your daughter's sake)

lines.speaker: Ual.
lines.text: To grant one Boone that I shall aske of you.

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: I grant it (for thine owne) what ere it be.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: These banish'd men, that I haue kept withall,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Are men endu'd with worthy qualities:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Forgiue them what they haue committed here,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And let them be recall'd from their Exile:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: They are reformed, ciuill, full of good,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And fit for great employment (worthy Lord.)

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Thou hast preuaild, I pardon them and thee:

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Dispose of them, as thou knowst their deserts.

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: Come, let vs goe, we will include all iarres,

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: With Triumphes, Mirth, and rare solemnity.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: And as we walke along, I dare be bold

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: With our discourse, to make your Grace to smile.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: What thinke you of this Page (my Lord?)

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: I think the Boy hath grace in him, he blushes.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: I warrant you (my Lord) more grace, then Boy.

lines.speaker: Duke.
lines.text: What meane you by that saying?

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Please you, Ile tell you, as we passe along,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: That you will wonder what hath fortuned:

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: Come {% italic: Protheus %}, 'tis your pennance, but to heare

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: The story of your Loues discouered.

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: That done, our day of marriage shall be yours,

lines.speaker: Val.
lines.text: One Feast, one house, one mutuall happinesse.
